title: Higher-Ranked Trait Bounds Crash the Compiler

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust pub trait Trait { type Item; } impl Trait for T where for<'a> &'a T: Trait, for<'a> <&'a T>::Item: Clone, {} ``` [Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=7e44b16dd50d61bf8109bc9c906fa3aa) Interestingly, this also crashes in the same way - even if the associated type is named "Iter", "Output", and several other names, - even if the associated type is not present in the trait, - and no matter what trait is used for the bound ```Rust pub trait Trait { } impl Trait for T where for<'a> &'a T: Trait, for<'a> <&'a T>::Output: Trait, {} ``` [Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=05e082ab8b90f0d1992eadb5350a4c6d) It does *not* crash when fully qualified syntax is used: ```Rust pub trait Trait { } impl Trait for T where for<'a> &'a T: Trait, for<'a> <&'a T as Trait>::Output: Trait, {} ``` [Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=13d5b29c5b1438019fa53eff5d8cc28d) ### Meta This bug only exists on stable. Based on what happens in a successful run on nightly ``` error[[E0223]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error_codes/E0223.html): ambiguous associated type --> src/lib.rs:5:17 | 5 | for<'a> <&'a T>::Output: Clone, | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | help: use the fully-qualified path | 5 | for<'a> <&'a T as FnOnce>::Output: Clone, | ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 5 | for<'a> <&'a T as IntoFuture>::Output: Clone, ``` it seems that something is going wrong when attempting to provide help messages for [E0223](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error_codes/E0223.html) `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.68.0 (2c8cc3432 2023-03-06) binary: rustc commit-hash: 2c8cc343237b8f7d5a3c3703e3a87f2eb2c54a74 commit-date: 2023-03-06 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.68.0 LLVM version: 15.0.6 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReErased <= ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(0:7 ~ playground[e57e]::{impl#0}::'a#1), 'a) }) ```
Backtrace
